byline.original: By ANDREA ZARATE and NICHOLAS CASEY

lead_paragraph: Mr. Kuczynski, an economist, appeared to have narrowly prevailed over the populist Keiko Fujimori, the daughter of an imprisoned former president.

headline.print_headline: Technocrat Appears to Prevail in Peru
headline.main: Pedro Kuczynski Declares Victory Over Keiko Fujimori for Peru Presidency

snippet: Mr. Kuczynski, an economist, appeared to have narrowly prevailed over the populist Keiko Fujimori, the daughter of an imprisoned former president.
abstract: Pedro Pablo Kuczynski is apparent winner of Peru's presidential election, narrowly defeating Keiko Fujimori, daughter of country's imprisoned former president; worldly technocrat is seen as alternative to populist, autocratic legacy of former Pres Alberto Fujimora.
